meanings.sent1: Her illusions about magic made her believe in things that weren't real.
meanings.sent2: The magician's illusions amazed the audience with their tricks.
meanings.sent3: His illusions about being able to fly led to some funny attempts with a cape.
meanings.sent4: The illusion of safety in the abandoned house quickly faded as they heard strange noises.
meanings.sent5: The mirage in the desert was a perfect example of illusions created by heat.

meanings.definition: Something that deceives the senses or mind
meanings.sent1: The optical illusions in the museum played tricks on visitors' eyes.
meanings.sent2: The mirage in the distance turned out to be just an illusion.
meanings.sent3: The funhouse mirrors created hilarious illusions of distorted faces.
meanings.sent4: The calm lake created a perfect illusion of a mirror reflecting the sky.
meanings.sent5: The magician's illusions were so convincing that no one could figure out the tricks.

meanings.sent1: The shimmering heat created illusions of water on the road.
meanings.sent2: The ghostly figure turned out to be just an illusion caused by shadows.
meanings.sent3: The illusion of a shortcut through the forest led them deeper into the woods.
meanings.sent4: The illusion of a peaceful town was shattered by the loud noise of construction.
meanings.sent5: The optical illusion made the painting seem to follow you wherever you went.
